It is convenient at this stage to introduce some simple terminology. Let D be a domain in £ " * with boundary Г. If P is a point of Г and iV is a neighborhood of P in £ " *, the set r^N is called a boundary neighborhood of P. A subset of Г is called open if it contains a boundary neighborhood of each of its points. Theorem 3 is now an immediate consequence of the following result. Lemma 5.
